item.title: Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered Player Creates Taylor Swift in the Game
item.description:
Summary

  • Oblivion Remastered's character creator is more versatile than the original, allowing players to make good-looking characters easily.
  • An Elder Scrolls player recreated Taylor Swift in the game with stunning resemblance, showcasing the remaster's impressive tools.

A talented Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered player online has shared their awesome recreation of pop star Taylor Swift in the game. The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered creation has an eerie resemblance to Swift, imagining what she could look like in the world of Cyrodiil.

The character creation system was always a huge part of the original Oblivion 's charm, so naturally, players were immediately curious to see whether Virtuos and Bethesda had kept it the same in the remaster. Oblivion Remastered players immediately began to create monsters in the character creator, which was a huge plus in the game's favor. However, it's immediately clear that it's far easier to make good-looking characters in Oblivion Remastered than it ever was in the original game, making the character creator more versatile than before.

Redditor Nekohrine shared their impressive Taylor Swift recreation in Oblivion Remastered 's character creator, and it has to be said that the resemblance is pretty staggering. It captures Swift's sharp and recognizable features perfectly, with many in the thread pointing out that they figured out who it was without even reading the post title. One user even joked that it "looks like she has a sold out tour at the Arena," while others hailed the fact that this is even possible in the new suite of tools in Bethesda and Virtuos' remaster.

Gamer Shows Off Accurate Taylor Swift in Oblivion Remastered

As a global superstar, Taylor Swift is often the subject of video game character creations. There was even a gamer who made a Githyanki version of Swift in Baldur's Gate 3 . Because she's so recognizable, it's immediately clear when she has been recreated in-game poorly by gamers, which is why the best creations come in games that have awesome character creators. It's a testament to Oblivion Remastered 's impressive tools that Nekohrine has been able to bring her to life so quickly in the RPG.

Oblivion Remastered is a great reintroduction to the land of Cyrodiil while Bethesda continues to work on The Elder Scrolls 6 . The long-awaited next title in the series was first announced back in 2018, but it still seems to be some time away yet with no release date in sight. Getting Oblivion back with an impressive fresh coat of paint is a great stop-gap while fans wait for Bethesda to finish up the next game.

item.title: Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment Can Finally Unmask One Major Tears of the Kingdom Secret
item.description:
With Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment taking fans back in time to showcase the events of the Imprisoning War, new plotlines and characters seem just around the corner. But some Tears of the Kingdom characters still hold mysteries that might also be answered in Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment . The upcoming third Hyrule Warriors game, Age of Imprisonment , will take players back in time with Princess Zelda as she fights in the war to imprison Ganondorf. The legendary Imprisoning War took center stage in Tears of the Kingdom as Link learned about how Ganondorf rose to power and was left sealed beneath Hyrule Castle by the founding King of Hyrule and his allies.

Princess Zelda, King Rauru, and the sages who held the secret stones are currently the only confirmed playable characters for Age of Imprisonment . It’s only natural that the sages who played such an important role in Imprisoning Ganondorf are included, but little was actually revealed about them in Tears of the Kingdom . With a big part to play in Age of Imprisonment , these nameless masked figures might finally be given the attention they deserve, making Age of Imprisonment a must-play game for Tears of the Kingdom fans.

Age of Imprisonment Needs to Expand on the Story of the Original Sages

So far, the story of the imprisoning war is that Ganondorf rose to power as Gerudo King, tried to take power over all of Hyrule, but was stopped by Zelda and her allies. As such, Zelda and Rauru are the only two playable characters in Age of Imprisonment with whom players have a strong connection. Some players may feel a connection to Mineru, the sage of spirit and Rauru’s sister, due to her flashback appearances in Tears of the Kingdom , but the other sages are essentially a blank slate. Aside from their races and descendants, almost nothing is known about the Gerudo, Rito, Zora, and Goron sages, leaving Age of Imprisonment ’s roster questionable. Unlike the champions of the past in Age of Calamity , these sages have no proper characterization. In order to feel like they have earned a spot on the roster, and for players to feel connected to them, the story of these sages must be revealed in Age of Imprisonment .

Age of Calamity , the last Hyrule Warriors game, had a similar problem with its roster, but solved the issue by using Zelda ’s common time travel trope to bring characters from Breath of the Wild into the story. Some are expecting a similar twist in Age of Imprisonment , but it could be a risky move, as the time travel in Age of Calamity was met with some controversy. However, if time travel doesn’t bring players more characters whom they already know, it will make it even more important to expand on the history and importance of the characters they will get to control.

What Else to Expect from Age Of Imprisonment’s Roster

The major draw of Age of Imprisonment is that fans will get to experience what Zelda went through after she disappeared in Tears of the Kingdom 's opening moments. This allows for an expanded version of her story, adding important lore to the history of Hyrule. With Age of Imprisonment confirmed to be canon to the Zelda universe, any new characters would need to hold an important place within the established lore.

One way to hype players up for the expanded story might be used in the Switch 2 version of Tears of the Kingdom . The Zelda notes app, only usable with the Switch 2 versions of the games, adds voice memories to Tears of the Kingdom and Breath of the Wild . With new lore being added to these games, it gives developers a chance to tease new characters who could appear in Age of Imprisonment .

Some fans are hopeful that Tears of the Kingdom ’s sages could be playable in Age of Imprisonment , accompanied by Link. It’s even possible that Zonai constructs could be reworked to fit the roster. No matter who else joins, though, the original sages will be central to Age of Imprisonment ’s story, and must receive the attention that they’re due.

item.title: Clash of Clans: Hero Equipment Tier List
item.description:
The Hero Hall is one of the main buildings in your Clash of Clans base, unlocking new heroes for your army. These heroes help defend your Home Village and stand strong alongside your regular troops in battle.

You can also upgrade your heroes to boost their HP and damage output, but sometimes, that’s just not enough to make them shine on the battlefield. That’s where Hero Equipment steps in. Equipping the right gear gives your heroes extra abilities — some let them summon support troops, while others deal bonus damage to multiple buildings at once. This guide will break down the best and worst Hero Equipment you should focus on in Clash of Clans .

Clash of Clans Hero Equipment, Explained

As mentioned above, Heroes are already a big help to your army, but adding Hero Equipments turns them into real powerhouses. There are five Heroes in Clash of Clans — Barbarian King, Archer Queen, Minion Prince, Grand Warden, and Royal Champion — and each one comes with several equipment options. But you can only equip two at a time , so choosing the right ones matters a lot.

Once you unlock Hero Equipments, your Heroes will start with a few basic ones, which you can add after building the Blacksmith (unlocked at Town Hall level eight). As you upgrade the Blacksmith, more common equipment will show up that you can craft using Ores. For Epic rarity tools, you’ll need to join Special Events or grab them from the League Shop.

Clash of Clans Hero Equipment Tier List

Here’s a rundown of the most to least useful Hero Equipments in Clash of Clans .

Hero Equipments

Tier

Giant Gauntlet

S Tier

Rage Vial

S Tier

Healer Puppet

S Tier

Magic Mirror

S Tier

Henchmen Puppet

S Tier

Dark Orb

S Tier

Eternal Tome

S Tier

Healing Tome

S Tier

Haste Vial

S Tier

Electro Boots

S Tier

Earthquake Boots

A Tier

Spiky Ball

A Tier

Invisibility Vial

A Tier

Action Figure

A Tier

Metal Pants

A Tier

Noble Iron

A Tier

Fireball

A Tier

Seeking Shield

A Tier

Rocket Spear

A Tier

Vampstache

B Tier

Snake Bracelet

B Tier

Archer Puppet

B Tier

Giant Arrow

B Tier

Rage Gem

B Tier

Hog Rider Puppet

B Tier

Barbarian Puppet

C Tier

Frozen Arrow

C Tier

Life Gem

C Tier

Lavaloon Puppet

D Tier

Royal Gem

D Tier

Just a heads-up — make sure you level them up at the Blacksmith to really feel their full strength, or else their impact won’t be as great. For example, the Eternal Tome’s ability only lasts about three seconds at level one, but once ranked up to level 18, it can stay active for over eight seconds.

Best Hero Equipment Combos in Clash of Clans

You can try these Hero Equipment combos to make your heroes a real force on the battlefield in Clash of Clans :

  • Equip Giant Gauntlet and Rage Vial on the Barbarian King to turn him into a massive tank for your team. Or swap them for Earthquake Boots and Spiky Ball if you’re aiming for quick and strong damage.
  • Pair Magic Mirror with Healer Puppet on Archer Queen— this combo makes her invisible and lets her last longer, plus she can summon Healers to support the whole squad.
  • The best pick for Minion Prince is the Henchmen Puppet and Dark Orb (an S-tier combo). But if you prefer, you can also go with Metal Pants and Noble Iron for a solid A-tier setup.
  • Use Eternal Tome and Healing Tome on Grand Warden to boost HP and give nearby troops immunity from damage.
  • Equip Electro Boots and Haste Vial on Royal Champion— this setup lets him attack faster and call down lightning strikes on enemy troops and buildings.

item.title: Small Oblivion Remastered Change is Disappointing Some OG Players
item.description:
Summary

  • Fans of Oblivion Remastered are upset about a small change to the Imperial City Arena.
  • Players are disappointed with the removal of physics from a lamp in the remastered version.
  • Fans are hopeful that the issue will be fixed via a patch or through modding.

Oblivion Remastered fans are pointing out a small change made to the Imperial City's Arena, and players are unhappy about it. While Oblivion Remastered has been received extremely well so far by most, that doesn't mean that it's completely perfect.

Bethesda took players by surprise when it confirmed rumors that an Oblivion remaster was in the works, largely due to dropping it the same day that it officially revealed it. Fans and newcomers alike to the game dove in as soon as they could, and quickly found an impressive remaster of Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion that remains true to the original while tweaking existing systems and dramatically overhauling visuals. However, there's been at least one change that's causing frustration for fans.

On Reddit, user Baekurly shared their frustration with a brief video of their character exiting the Imperial City Arena. As they head down the tunnel leading back to the interior training chambers, their character hops up to hit the lamp hanging from the ceiling, which doesn't budge. The player then runs back to it and tries again, only to find that it's a completely static object. This is a change from the original game, which included physics for the lamp, allowing players to bump into it as they passed and cause it to swing around.

Oblivion Players Lament Change Amid Onslaught of Praise

Fans in the comments have been quick to share their thoughts on the change, with those who played the original expressing disappointment with the alteration. While it might seem like a silly surface-level change that doesn't mean anything to some, others have pointed out that back when Oblivion originally launched, seeing so many objects in the game have physics was mind-blowing, and that includes the lamp. Several players noted that they included the lamp in a sort of pre- or post-game ritual, bumping it for good luck or to pat themselves on the back for a win.

For whatever reason, it seems like the physics properties were removed from the lamp, with it becoming a static object instead. It's not clear why this change was made, though it was likely just an oversight. The vast majority of the game has remained intact, including some of the original bloopers in Oblivion that made it into the remaster.

While this change likely won't dampen most fans' experiences overall, those leaving comments have already talked about alerting Bethesda to the change. Some are hopeful that with enough complaints, the game might receive a patch fixing the issue. If that doesn't work out, though, chances are that despite Oblivion Remastered not having official mod support, a modder will be able to convert it extremely quickly for those who want it back the way it used to be.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Reveals Half-Year Anniversary Rewards
item.description:
Summary

  • Pokemon TCG Pocket is celebrating its half-year anniversary with special rewards.
  • Rewards include a Shaymin coin and full art Rayquaza card.
  • New expansion Celestial Guardians with 200+ cards is coming soon.

Pokemon TCG Pocket has revealed its half-year anniversary rewards. Released in October 2024, Pokemon TCG Pocket has been a massive success.

For those who don't know, Pokemon TCG Pocket has simpler rules than the physical Pokemon Trading Card game. Players' decks are made up of 20 cards, and there is a limit of 50 turns for them to achieve victory. The great appeal of DeNA's game is, however, the cards that players pull by opening booster packs. To date, two expansions and three mini-sets have been released: the most recent is the Shining Revelry mini-set, which added 111 cards and marked the debut of shiny Pokemon in Pokemon TCG Pocket . Celebrating six months of this journey, the developers have announced special gifts that will be available soon.

Pokemon TCG Pocket will launch a new round of missions and solo battles starting on Tuesday, April 29 at 11 pm PDT to celebrate six months of release. Until Monday, May 12, at 10:59 PDT, players can take part in solo battles to win Promo Pack A Series Vol. 7 boosters that include a full art Rayquaza EX card as the main reward. By completing special missions by Wednesday, May 28, at 10:59 PDT, players can get a coin of the Mythical Pokemon Shaymin and a playmat with Charmander, Piplup, Rockruff, and other Pokemon. It's important to note that apart from Rayquaza EX, the other promotional cards that will be available at the solo battle event have not been revealed.

Pokemon Celebrates Six Months of Release With Special Rewards

  • Rayquaza EX card
  • Shaymin coin
  • Playmat with Charmander, Piplup, Rockruff and other Pokemon

In the solo battle events, Pokemon TCG Pocket players face off against the AI in matches of various difficulty levels and earn rewards such as promotional card packs. This card is a variation of those already in the game, but with a few differences, such as different attributes or alternative artwork, and a Poke Ball stamp. The coins and playmats are the Pokemon TCG Pocket accessories that players use to make the experience of creating their dream decks even more engaging.

The six-month celebration isn't the only announcement made by DeNA, as Pokemon TCG Pocket will soon get a new set. Named Celestial Guardians, the upcoming expansion will add more than 200 cards for players to collect, including ex variants of the Legendary Pokemon Solgaleo and Lunala, and the first immersive Support card.
